titleStmt.title: The trve copie of His Maiesties gracious pardon which His Majestie hath lately sent and now once againe doth offer to all his loving subjects as it is mentioned in one of the propositions if yet they will forbeare to take up or levy any more armes in a hostile manner against his person, crowne, and dignity : excepting such persons which have been formerly excepted, &c.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

titleStmt.title: The trve copie of His Maiesties gracious pardon which His Majestie hath lately sent and now once againe doth offer to all his loving subjects as it is mentioned in one of the propositions if yet they will forbeare to take up or levy any more armes in a hostile manner against his person, crowne, and dignity : excepting such persons which have been formerly excepted, &c.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

notesStmt.note: First printed at Oxford and now reprinted at London, 1642. cf. Madan.
"This appears to be a mere London reissue of the original general pardon granted by Charles I at his first session in 1625, with the date falsified and even now inconsistant." cf. Madan.
Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
